result.execSummary:
The defendant Teagan J. Spaay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE FTW/Shooling or combination of the two.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

Assessments/counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and follow up.
Letter of apology to victims: S.B. & C.B.; Weston Pick N Save and Rib Mt Walmart Store #60
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber for drug & alcohol treatment/NA/AA meetings.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.

Pay all unpaid financial obligations.

Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Absolute sobriety from illicit substances.   Defendant shall be released under supervision of her father, Paul J. Defendant is allowed to live at Mother and Father's house..  Upon successful completion of in-patient treatment, defendant shall continue to reside at her Mother or father's residence and not return to MCJ.
